metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10088 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The sg implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.9 does not properlyrestrict write operations in situations where the KERNEL_DS option is set,which allows local users to read or write to arbitrary kernel memorylocations or cause a denial of service (use-after-free) by leveragingaccess to a /dev/sg device, related to block/bsg.c and drivers/scsi/sg.c.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2016-9576.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-125.174
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
